/.attribution: J. R. R. Tolkien, The Fellowship of the Ring
/.text: Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.

/finished.text: Giving up smoking is the easiest thing in the world. I know because I've done it thousands of times.

/linkedout.text: We keep inventing jobs because of this false idea that everybody has to be employed at some kind of drudgery because, according to Malthusian-Darwinian theory he must justify his right to exist.

/personal-development.text: I say never be complete, I say stop being perfect, I say let... let's evolve, let the chips fall where they may.

/projects.attribution: Time, Alice Through the Looking Glass
/projects.text: Everyone parts with everything eventually, my dear.

/projects/assembly-language.attribution: J. R. Ross, Constraints on Variables in Syntax
/projects/assembly-language.text: It's no use Mr James--it's turtles all the way down.

/projects/electronics.text: He who fights with monsters should be careful lest he thereby become a monster.

/transformation.text: You could not step twice into the same river; everything changes and nothing stands still.
